repnme.cdata!: Tanzania - Cashew and Coconut Treecrops Project

abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Cashew and Coconut Treecrops Project
            (CCTP) in Tanzania. The objectives of the project were to
            achieve long-term growth by increasing the national
            production of cashewnuts for export, and the production of
            coconuts for the domestic oil market.  Bank's
            performance was satisfactory. Borrower's performance
            was marginally satisfactory. The key lessons learned were as
            follows: (i) flexibility is important in the implementation
            of project activities, to allow for changing circumstances,
            priorities and initial project assumptions that prove to be
            invalid;  (ii) reservations concerning the cost
            effectiveness of the dual management structure of the
            project were justified; (iii) a single CCTP management unit
            agreed to during the MTR was more effective;(iv) mechanisms
            for procurement and disbursement were consistently
            problematical for project implementors; (v) more time is
            needed to complete research objectives in plant breeding
            aspects; (vi) greater allowance for failure of improved
            plant materials should be factored into project appraisals;
            (vii) building upon or scaling up previous pilot operations
            can help assure a greater degree of success; and (viii) an
            effective mid-term review can help in restructuring or
            putting a project onto a solid basis.

Tanzania - Cashew And Coconut

repnme.cdata!: Tanzania - Cashew and Coconut Treecrops Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Cashew and Coconut
            Treecrops Project are to achieve long term growth by
            increasing the national production of cashewnuts for export
            and the production of coconuts for the domestic vegetable
            oil market. The project will provide financing and technical
            assistance in support of: (i) expanded cashew and coconut
            research breeding and selection to develop higher yielding,
            more disease and drought tolerant varieties/hybrids; (ii)
            the development and operation of seven cashew development
            centers and three coconut seed farms for the propagation and
            dissemination of quality planting materials; (iii)
            production development through the training of extension and
            research staff and the dissemination of cashew and coconut
            production packages; (iv) the management and coordination of
            the cashew improvement and coconut development programs; (v)
            cashew input supply and local marketing support; and (vi)
            strengthening credit facilities in the southern cashewnut
            production areas in the form of a pilot credit scheme.
